      • CommandApdu

        public CommandApdu(int cla,
                   int ins,
                   int p1,
                   int p2,
                   byte[] data)

        Constructs a case 3 APDU If data is null or empty, it constructs a case 1 APDU. Command data length Nc is derived from the byte array of data param

        Parameters:
        cla - class octet of command APDU
        ins - INS octet of command APDU
        p1 - P1 octet of command APDU
        p2 - P2 octet of command APDU
        data - command data

      • CommandApdu

        public CommandApdu(int cla,
                   int ins,
                   int p1,
                   int p2,
                   byte[] data,
                   java.lang.Integer ne)

        Constructs a case 4 APDU from the four header bytes, command data, and expected response data length. Command data length Nc is derived from the byte array of data param

        If data is empty or null and/or ne is null, APDU is encoded as case 1, 2, or 3 per ISO 7816 respectively.

        Parameters:
        cla - CLA byte
        ins - INS byte
        p1 - P1 byte
        p2 - P2 byte
        data - data octet string if data is null it is encoded as case 1 or 3 respectively
        ne - number of expected bytes in response. if ne is null it is encoded as case 1 or 3 respectively ne = 0 is encoded as wildcard (short or extended) ne = AbstractApdu.EXPECTED_LENGTH_WILDCARD_SHORT or ne = AbstractApdu.EXPECTED_LENGTH_WILDCARD_EXTENDED it is encoded as short or extended wildcard respectively
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown in case of invalid parameter values
